contentrichtext.text: :''Not to be confused with [[The Youngbloods]].'' {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = YoungBloodZ | image = Youngbloodz-June9 2007.JPEG | caption = YoungBloodZ performing live for U.S. armed servicemen in Germany on June 9, 2007. | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Atlanta, Georgia]] | genre = [[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] | years_active = 1997-present | label = [[LaFace Records|LaFace]], [[Cornerstore Entertainment]] | associated_acts = [[Lil Jon]], [[Sean P Joseph]], [[Attic Crew]], [[Front Street Entertainment]] [[Redirect]] | website = [http://cornerstoreentertainment.com/ Official website] | Twitter = [[url|www.twitter.com/youngbloodz]] Twitter | current_members = [[Sean P (rapper)|Sean P Joseph]] <br />[[J-Bo]] }} '''YoungBloodZ''' are an [[United States|American]] [[Southern rap]] [[Duet (music)|duo]] from [[Atlanta, Georgia]], comprising members [[J-Bo]] (born '''Jeffrey Ray Grigsby''' on October 4, 1977) and [[Sean P (rapper)|Sean P Joseph]] (formerly known as Sean Paul, but changed his name to avoid confusion with [[Sean Paul|the Jamaican reggae/dancehall artist of the same name]] (Sean P was born Sean Paul Joseph on March 7, 1978)). == Biography == The two met at Decatur's Miller Grove Middle School, where they started the Attic Crew with some friends.<ref>''[[Rap Pages]]'' magazine, Volume 8, p. 136, 1999</ref> They are signed to [[LaFace Records]] and are best known for singles such as "U-Way" (1999) and "85" (2000), featuring [[Big Boi]] of [[OutKast]] and Chris Streng. After a three year absence, they returned with "Cadillac Pimpin'", scoring a moderate hit. However, the duo achieved a major hit with "[[Damn! (song)|Damn!]]" produced by [[Lil Jon]], which reached No. 4 on the [[Billboard Hot 100]] and has been their only (solo) Top 10 hit to date. Two years later, they returned with "Datz Me" featuring [[Young Buck]], a then member of [[G-Unit]] and another Lil' Jon produced hit "[[Presidential (song)|Presidential]]". They released their second single, "Chop Chop", from their third album, ''[[Ev'rybody Know Me]]'', which was produced by [[Scott Storch]]. The YoungBloodZ song "I'mma Shine" was featured in the 2006 movie [[Step Up]] and in its soundtrack. The soundtrack reached number one on the US Billboard Top Soundtracks in 2006. Sean P has made numerous appearances in hit singles including [[Cherish (band)|Cherish]]'s "Do It to It", [[Sammie]]'s "[[You Should Be My Girl]]", and [[Lil Jon]]'s "[[Snap Yo Fingers]]" with [[E-40]]. He is currently working on a solo project under #Cadillac Music [[Cornerstore Entertainment]] that is scheduled for release sometime in the near future. The first official single is entitled "Shoes Match The Hat" and was produced by Cristal Carter. HerringBone (fomerly Jbo) currnet new album 86'd on Phuturedelic Records. == Legal issues == Both members were arrested on June 1, 2006 on drugs and weapons charges in Atlanta with members of their entourage after a traffic stop involving an expired license plate. J-Bo and Sean P never had any trouble with the law before this arrest.<ref>{{cite news|last=Harris|first=Chris|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1533517/youngbloodz-booked-on-drug-weapons-charges.jhtml|title=Youngbloodz Booked On Drug, Weapons Charges|date=2006-06-04|publisher=mtv.com|accessdate=2013-01-10}}</ref> == Discography == {{main|YoungBloodZ discography}} * ''[[Against da Grain]]'' (1999) * ''[[Drankin' Patnaz]]'' (2003) * ''[[Ev'rybody Know Me]]'' (2005) == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{Official website|cornerstoreenter­tainment.­com}} * [{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=youngbloodz|chart=all}} Billboard chart history] {{YoungBloodZ}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Youngbloodz}} [[Category:Musical groups from Georgia (U.S. state)]] [[Category:Southern hip hop groups]] [[Category:American hip hop groups]] [[Category:African-American rappers]] [[Category:Rappers from Atlanta, Georgia]]
